summary.implementation_status: No formal warranty claim workflow exists. Currently warranty claims go through generic issues table with type='claim'. Basic claim submission exists via IssueForm with initialValues.type='claim' from warranty detail page. However, there is no: dedicated claim intake form with serial lookup, verification checklist, approval routing, resolution type handling (repair/replace/refund), product return handling, or claim analytics. All 6 stories represent genuine gaps requiring new schema, server functions, and UI.

dependencies_on_other_domains.DOM-WAR-006: Warranty Claim Workflow from warranty domain - this workflow PRD builds on that foundation
dependencies_on_other_domains.DOM-WAR-008: Warranty Analytics - WF-WAR-006 depends on this for data
dependencies_on_other_domains.DOM-SUP-003: RMA (Return Authorization) - WF-WAR-005 depends on RMA workflow for return handling

existing_claim_workflow.description: Quick issue creation from warranty detail page with type='claim' pre-selected
features: Report Issue button opens IssueForm with warrantyId and type='claim' pre-filled
Issues linked to warranties shown in 'Related Issues' tab
Basic issue workflow: open -> in_progress -> resolved/closed
limitations: No claim-specific form fields (evidence, reason codes)
No claim number generation (uses issue number ISS-YYYY-NNNN)
No resolution type integration (repair/replace/refund creates no follow-on actions)

schema_files: renoz-v2/lib/schema/issues.ts - issues table used for claims
missing_tables: warranty_claims - dedicated claim entity with status workflow
server_functions: renoz-v2/src/server/functions/issues.ts - generic issue CRUD (createIssue, resolveIssue with resolutionType)
missing_server_functions: createWarrantyClaim - with serial lookup and warranty validation
processClaimResolution - create repair job/replacement order/credit note
missing_components: warranty-claim-form.tsx - dedicated claim intake with serial lookup

existing_resolution_types.notes: Resolution types exist but don't trigger follow-on actions (no order creation for replacement, no credit note for refund, no service job for repair)

prd_claims_verified: Basic claim via issue - VERIFIED (IssueForm with type='claim' from warranty detail)
Warranty lookup - VERIFIED (listWarranties searches by serial number)

WF-WAR-001.name: Add Warranty Claim Intake
WF-WAR-001.reason: Currently claims use generic IssueForm. This story adds dedicated claim intake with: serial number lookup, auto-populate warranty details, claim reason codes, evidence upload, claim number generation (CLM-XXXXXX), customer confirmation. Requires new schema (warranty_claims table), server functions, and UI components.

dependencies_on_other_prd.DOM-WAR-006: Warranty Claim Workflow from warranty domain provides foundation

WF-WAR-002.name: Add Warranty Verification Step
WF-WAR-002.reason: No verification workflow exists. Claims go directly to issue status. This story adds: verification checklist (warranty active, coverage check, previous claims, product condition), auto-deny for expired warranty, escalation for ambiguous cases, verification notes. Requires verification_status field and checklist tracking.

acceptance_criteria_review.notes: Auto-deny logic needs clear rules: expired warranty, claim outside coverage period, coverage type mismatch. Escalation path needs definition.

dependencies_on_other_prd.WF-WAR-001: Claim intake must exist before verification

WF-WAR-003.name: Add Claim Approval Routing
WF-WAR-003.reason: No approval workflow exists. Current claims can be resolved by anyone. This story adds: value-based thresholds (<$500 auto-approve, >$500 manager approval), approval queue, approve/deny with comments, approval notifications, denial reason with appeal option, audit trail. Requires role-based permissions and approval tracking.

acceptance_criteria_review.notes: Approval thresholds configurable vs hardcoded? Appeal workflow adds complexity - consider deferring to later story.

dependencies_on_other_prd.WF-WAR-002: Verification must complete before approval routing

WF-WAR-004.name: Add Resolution Options
WF-WAR-004.reason: Resolution types exist (replaced/refunded/repaired) but don't trigger actions. This story adds: replacement = create order with replacement product, repair = create service job, refund = create credit note. Resolution tracking until complete, customer notification. Significant integration with orders, jobs, and financial domains.

acceptance_criteria_review.notes: Replacement order uses existing createOrder function. Repair job may need jobs domain integration. Credit note requires financial domain - verify credit_notes table exists.

cross_domain_integrations: Jobs domain - create service job for repair
Financial domain - create credit note for refund

WF-WAR-005.name: Add Product Return Handling
WF-WAR-005.reason: No return handling for warranty claims. This story adds: return label generation (manual), shipment tracking, receipt and inspection, disposition (scrap/refurbish/return to supplier), link return to claim, complete claim after return processed. Depends on DOM-SUP-003 RMA workflow.

acceptance_criteria_review.notes: Manual return label = user uploads or enters tracking number. Disposition options affect inventory. Return to supplier may need supplier domain integration.

dependencies_on_other_prd.DOM-SUP-003: RMA workflow from support domain - CRITICAL DEPENDENCY

blocker_analysis.impact: Cannot implement return handling until RMA workflow exists
blocker_analysis.recommendation: Defer WF-WAR-005 until DOM-SUP-003 complete, OR implement basic return tracking without full RMA integration

WF-WAR-006.name: Add Warranty Claim Analytics
WF-WAR-006.reason: No claim analytics exist. This story adds: claims by product/batch for quality issues, claim rate over time, average claim cost, root cause categorization, supplier quality correlation, export. Depends on DOM-WAR-008 warranty analytics which provides foundation.

acceptance_criteria_review.notes: Root cause categorization needs claim reason codes. Supplier correlation needs supplier linkage on products.

recommended_stories.name: Warranty Claims Schema
recommended_stories.description: Create warranty_claims table with claim number generation and basic status workflow
acceptance_criteria: warranty_claims table created (id, claimNumber, warrantyId, customerId, status, claimType, claimReason, description, evidence JSONB, estimatedValue, submittedAt, organizationId)
Claim number generation function: get_next_claim_number returning CLM-NNNNNN format
Claim status enum: submitted, verifying, verified, pending_approval, approved, denied, processing, resolved
Claim type enum: defect, malfunction, damage, missing_parts, other
Indexes on organizationId, warrantyId, customerId, status
Types exported from lib/schema/index.ts
TypeScript compiles without errors

recommended_stories.name: Warranty Claims Server Functions
recommended_stories.description: Implement claim CRUD with warranty lookup and validation
acceptance_criteria: createWarrantyClaim function with warranty lookup by serial number
Auto-populate warranty details (product, customer, expiry) from warranty record
Validate warranty is active and not expired at submission time
Check for duplicate claims on same warranty (configurable: allow/block)
listWarrantyClaims with filters (status, customerId, warrantyId, dateRange)
getWarrantyClaim with full warranty context
updateWarrantyClaim with OCC (optimistic concurrency control)
Validation schemas in lib/schemas/warranty-claims.ts
TypeScript compiles without errors

recommended_stories.description: Dedicated claim submission form with serial lookup and evidence upload
acceptance_criteria: WarrantyClaimForm component with serial number lookup field
Serial lookup shows warranty details (product, expiry, customer, previous claims count)
Claim type and reason selection dropdowns
Description field with minimum character requirement
Evidence upload (photos/documents) with preview
Submission confirmation dialog with claim number
Route at /support/claims/new
Claims list page at /support/claims with status filters
TypeScript compiles without errors

recommended_stories.name: Warranty Claim Customer Notification
recommended_stories.description: Send confirmation email to customer on claim submission
acceptance_criteria: Email template for claim submission confirmation
Includes: claim number, warranty details, expected timeline
Trigger.dev job for async email sending
Email history tracked on claim record
TypeScript compiles without errors

recommended_stories.description: Add verification fields and checklist tracking to claims
acceptance_criteria: warranty_claims.verificationStatus enum: pending, passed, failed, escalated
warranty_claims.verificationChecklist JSONB with standard checks
warranty_claims.verificationNotes text field
warranty_claims.verifiedAt timestamp
warranty_claims.verifiedByUserId FK to users
Standard checklist items: warranty_active, coverage_valid, no_prior_claims, product_unmodified

recommended_stories.name: Claim Verification Logic
recommended_stories.description: Implement verification workflow with auto-deny and escalation
acceptance_criteria: verifyWarrantyClaim server function with checklist processing
Auto-deny if warranty expired at claim date
Auto-deny if prior claim exists and policy is one-claim-only
Escalation trigger for ambiguous cases (flag set manually)
Status transitions: submitted -> verifying -> verified/denied/escalated
Verification creates activity record for audit
TypeScript compiles without errors

recommended_stories.name: Claim Verification UI
recommended_stories.description: Verification checklist UI with pass/fail controls
acceptance_criteria: ClaimVerificationChecklist component with checkbox items
Each item shows pass/fail/skip with reason field
Warranty status displayed prominently (active/expired)
Previous claims on warranty listed if any
Verify/Deny/Escalate action buttons
Verification notes field required on deny/escalate
Integrated into claim detail page
TypeScript compiles without errors

recommended_stories.name: Claim Approval Schema
acceptance_criteria: warranty_claims.approvalStatus enum: not_required, pending, approved, denied, appealed
warranty_claims.approvalRequired boolean (set based on value threshold)
warranty_claims.approvedAt timestamp
warranty_claims.approvedByUserId FK to users
warranty_claims.approvalNotes text field
warranty_claims.denialReason text field
claim_approval_thresholds table for configurable thresholds per org
TypeScript compiles without errors

recommended_stories.name: Claim Approval Workflow
recommended_stories.description: Implement approval routing based on claim value
acceptance_criteria: checkApprovalRequired function based on estimatedValue vs threshold
Claims below threshold auto-approve after verification
Claims above threshold enter pending_approval status
approveWarrantyClaim function (requires manager role)
denyWarrantyClaim function with required reason
Approval notification to claim submitter
Denial notification with reason to customer
TypeScript compiles without errors

recommended_stories.name: Claim Approval UI
acceptance_criteria: Approval queue page showing pending claims
Queue filters: date range, value range, claim type
Queue sortable by value, age, customer priority
ClaimApprovalDialog with approve/deny options
Approval requires confirmation
Denial requires reason selection + notes
Approval history visible on claim detail
TypeScript compiles without errors

atomization_notes.WF-WAR-001: Split into 4 stories: schema (2), server (4), UI (4), notification (2) = 12 total iterations
atomization_notes.WF-WAR-002: Split into 3 stories: schema (2), server logic (3), UI checklist (3) = 8 total iterations
atomization_notes.WF-WAR-003: Split into 3 stories: schema (2), workflow (4), UI (4) = 10 total iterations
atomization_notes.WF-WAR-004: Split into 4 stories per resolution type: replacement order (4), repair job (4), credit note (3), UI (4) = 15 total iterations. Consider implementing one resolution type at a time.
atomization_notes.WF-WAR-005: Blocked by DOM-SUP-003 RMA. Split into 3 stories when unblocked: integration (4), return tracking UI (3), disposition (3) = 10 total iterations
atomization_notes.WF-WAR-006: Single story adjustable: server queries (4), UI analytics page (4) = 8 total iterations. Can leverage existing warranty report foundation.

DOM-WAR-006.impact: Provides warranty claim workflow foundation from warranty domain. WF-WARRANTY builds on this.
DOM-WAR-006.recommendation: Can proceed independently since WF-WARRANTY is more comprehensive than DOM-WAR-006

DOM-WAR-008.impact: WF-WAR-006 analytics can leverage DOM-WAR-008 warranty analytics queries
DOM-WAR-008.recommendation: Implement WF-WAR-006 independently or after DOM-WAR-008

DOM-SUP-003.impact: BLOCKER for WF-WAR-005 Product Return Handling
DOM-SUP-003.recommendation: Defer WF-WAR-005 until DOM-SUP-003 implemented, OR implement basic return tracking without RMA

priority_recommendation.reason: Foundation for all other stories. Claim intake is the entry point for the workflow.
Verification prevents invalid claims from consuming approval resources.
Approval routing controls costs and provides audit trail.
Resolution options complete the workflow. Most business value here.
Analytics provide quality insights. Can be implemented before WF-WAR-005.
Blocked by DOM-SUP-003. Defer until RMA workflow exists.

execution_order_recommendation: WF-WAR-002a (Verification Schema) - 2 iterations - can parallel with WF-WAR-001c/d
WF-WAR-003a (Approval Schema) - 2 iterations - can parallel with WF-WAR-002
WF-WAR-005 (Product Returns) - 10 iterations - DEFERRED until DOM-SUP-003 complete

risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Implement simplified return tracking without full RMA, or defer WF-WAR-005

risks_and_mitigations.risk: Resolution type integrations (orders, jobs, financial) add complexity
risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Implement one resolution type at a time. Start with replacement (uses existing orders).
Verify user roles exist and have appropriate permissions defined.

risks_and_mitigations.risk: Claim number collisions in high-volume scenarios
risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Use Postgres function with advisory lock like existing warranty/issue number generation.

risks_and_mitigations.risk: Evidence upload storage and size limits
risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Use existing attachment handling patterns. Consider compression for images.

testing_requirements: Unit tests for warranty validation logic (expired, coverage, duplicate claims)
Unit tests for approval threshold calculation
Integration tests for claim lifecycle (submit -> verify -> approve -> resolve)
Integration tests for resolution type action creation
E2E test for claim submission flow with serial lookup
E2E test for approval queue workflow
